newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil gains on futures, no move in premiums.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil gains on futures, no move in premiums.

text.p: NWE gas oil was pulled higher on Friday by stronger futures and steady premiums in a fairly quiet market.
May IPE gas oil was trading $1.75 a tonne stronger at $170.75 at 1145 GMT.
Heating oil barges were still being offered at May IPE +$1 fob ARA for refinery material, but having trouble securing a great deal of business.
Cargo premiums were also steady with FOD steady around June IPE +$4-5 with DIN about 50 cents stronger.
Diesel, which has lost some of its gloss in recent days, was broadly steady with offers heard at June IPE +$12.25 cif NWE.
